answers.answer: Yeah - the funding for Hep C stinks.  I know this topic on FAIR can rattle some people's nerves, but the funding for Hep C in relation to other diseases just stinks - flat out stinks.  Dr. Richard Darling (the founder of FAIR) is a very nice man.  They don't make 'em any better as far as I'm concerned as far as advocating for Hep C and as far as just being a good guy and wanting fair distribution of research funding for ALL diseases.  If you get the chance, go look at some of his media on that main site (Hep C rallies he's been to).  He sent me the book he wrote, Coma Life, (about his experience with liver transplants and being in a coma).  If you ever get a chance, read it - it's great.  He's just the nicest man you'll ever hope to meet no matter what your disease is, but - if you have Hep C, yep.  He's got us in his heart (not just in his pocket).  I've been in some heated discussions about my support of FAIR.  Never knew I would hit such a nerve if I put a link for FAIR up (but boy did I get an ear full)  Oh well - too bad is all I can say about it.  I have my disease to worry about too, ya know, and "fair is fair".  Glad you posted this.And btw, glad you're UND, TOO!! :)
